content: Do you like the IRS? comments.body: ^^^ I haven't looked at IRS paperwork for a long time. So I ask... Years ago the IRS said in many of their pamphlets that the income tax was voluntary. Is there still this voluntary compliance wording in their paperwork?Here is what all IRS payment is all about. Of course, the IRS doesn't tell you that you owe because of signed agreements.The trick is to use the right wording to defend yourself, without accidentally agreeing that the IRS has a legitimate agreement with you. It starts with not signing paperwork with them in the first place... or how you sign the paperwork when you do. The W-4 Form is IRS paperwork. And there are many others. The answer is to NOT give them your money and private life info, and to sign any IRS docs non-assumpsit... no contract or agreement.There is a lot more, and this isn't the place.
